conclusion: The total resistance in the circuit is the sum of the internal resistance \( r \) of the coil and the external resistor \( R \): \( R_{\text{total}} = r + R = 10 \, \Omega + 50 \, \Omega = 60 \, \Omega \)

conclusion: Using Ohm's law, the current \( I \) in the circuit is: \( I = \frac{\mathcal{E}}{R_{\text{total}}} = \frac{-10 \, \text{V}}{60 \, \Omega} = -\frac{1}{6} \, \text{A} \)
